intro: Didymocarpus parviflorus, commonly known as the small-flowered sandalwood, is a tropical evergreen tree belonging to the family Rubiaceae. It is native to Southeast Asia and is characterized by its small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has simple, opposite leaves and produces small, woody fruits that contain a single seed. It thrives in humid, shady environments and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in horticulture.
